chapter.keywords: online king james holy bible, king james bible, bible todo list, words of Jesus, bible index, the authorised version, KJV, KJB, KJAV, AV

items.text: I am come into my garden, my sister, my spouse: I have gathered my myrrh with my spice; I have eaten my honeycomb with my honey; I have drunk my wine with my milk: eat, O friends; drink, yea, drink abundantly, O beloved.
items.plainText: I am come into my garden, my sister, my spouse: I have gathered my myrrh with my spice; I have eaten my honeycomb with my honey; I have drunk my wine with my milk: eat, O friends; drink, yea, drink abundantly, O beloved.

items.text: I sleep, but my heart waketh: it is the voice of my beloved that knocketh, saying, Open to me, my sister, my love, my dove, my undefiled: for my head is filled with dew, and my locks with the drops of the night.
items.plainText: I sleep, but my heart waketh: it is the voice of my beloved that knocketh, saying, Open to me, my sister, my love, my dove, my undefiled: for my head is filled with dew, and my locks with the drops of the night.

items.text: I have put off my coat; how shall I put it on? I have washed my feet; how shall I defile them?
items.plainText: I have put off my coat; how shall I put it on? I have washed my feet; how shall I defile them?

items.text: My beloved put in his hand by the hole of the door, and my bowels were moved for him.
items.plainText: My beloved put in his hand by the hole of the door, and my bowels were moved for him.

items.text: I rose up to open to my beloved; and my hands dropped with myrrh, and my fingers with sweet smelling myrrh, upon the handles of the lock.
items.plainText: I rose up to open to my beloved; and my hands dropped with myrrh, and my fingers with sweet smelling myrrh, upon the handles of the lock.

items.text: I opened to my beloved; but my beloved had withdrawn himself, and was gone: my soul failed when he spake: I sought him, but I could not find him; I called him, but he gave me no answer.
items.plainText: I opened to my beloved; but my beloved had withdrawn himself, and was gone: my soul failed when he spake: I sought him, but I could not find him; I called him, but he gave me no answer.

items.text: The watchmen that went about the city found me, they smote me, they wounded me; the keepers of the walls took away my veil from me.
items.plainText: The watchmen that went about the city found me, they smote me, they wounded me; the keepers of the walls took away my veil from me.

items.text: I charge you, O daughters of Jerusalem, if ye find my beloved, that ye tell him, that I am sick of love.
items.plainText: I charge you, O daughters of Jerusalem, if ye find my beloved, that ye tell him, that I am sick of love.

items.text: What is thy beloved more than another beloved, O thou fairest among women? what is thy beloved more than another beloved, that thou dost so charge us?
items.plainText: What is thy beloved more than another beloved, O thou fairest among women? what is thy beloved more than another beloved, that thou dost so charge us?

items.text: My beloved is white and ruddy, the chiefest among ten thousand.
items.plainText: My beloved is white and ruddy, the chiefest among ten thousand.

items.text: His head is as the most fine gold, his locks are bushy, and black as a raven.
items.plainText: His head is as the most fine gold, his locks are bushy, and black as a raven.

items.text: His eyes are as the eyes of doves by the rivers of waters, washed with milk, and fitly set.
items.plainText: His eyes are as the eyes of doves by the rivers of waters, washed with milk, and fitly set.

items.text: His cheeks are as a bed of spices, as sweet flowers: his lips like lilies, dropping sweet smelling myrrh.
items.plainText: His cheeks are as a bed of spices, as sweet flowers: his lips like lilies, dropping sweet smelling myrrh.

items.text: His hands are as gold rings set with the beryl: his belly is as bright ivory overlaid with sapphires.
items.plainText: His hands are as gold rings set with the beryl: his belly is as bright ivory overlaid with sapphires.

items.text: His legs are as pillars of marble, set upon sockets of fine gold: his countenance is as Lebanon, excellent as the cedars.
items.plainText: His legs are as pillars of marble, set upon sockets of fine gold: his countenance is as Lebanon, excellent as the cedars.

items.text: His mouth is most sweet: yea, he is altogether lovely. This is my beloved, and this is my friend, O daughters of Jerusalem.
items.plainText: His mouth is most sweet: yea, he is altogether lovely. This is my beloved, and this is my friend, O daughters of Jerusalem.
